description.narrative: UNDP will support strengthening the capacity of the media, for improved engagement in the lead up to and during the elections, that are planned to be held in Iraq in 2021.

4.1.1 # of journalists , from media outlets across Iraq and KRI, who have been trained online on professional election coverage according to international standards (disaggregated by age, gender and geographic distribution) 4.1.2 # of journalists , from media outlets across Iraq and KRI, who have been mentored by subject matter experts from online training workshops or partner CSOs. 4.2.1. # of journalists, from media outlets across Iraq and KRI, trained online on recognising and combating hate speech, and gender-sensitive reporting. 4.2.2. # of journalists , from media outlets across Iraq and KRI, who have been mentored by subject matter experts from training workshops or partner CSOs. 4.3.1. # of journalists , from media outlets across Iraq and KRI, who have trained online on the production of inclusive media content. (disaggregated by age, gender and geographic distribution) 4.3.2. # of journalists , from media outlets across Iraq and KRI, who have been mentored by subject matter experts from training workshops or partner CSOs. (disaggregated b age, gender and geographic distribution) 4.4.1. Social media campaign publishing IHEC messaging and other voter education content developed. 4.5.1 # of factsheets or fact-checked statements made by power holders and related to the Iraqi elections produced and published on social media 4.6.1 # of media monitor reports produced tracking the quality of content in relation to the elections and tracking the IHEC’s performance.

comment.narrative: 4.1.1:40-50 journalists have been trained online and mentored on professional election coverage according to international standards, across Iraq and KRI. 4.1.2: At least 20 journalists have received one-to-one mentorship by subject matter experts/trainers or partner CSOs. 4.2.1: 30-40 journalists trained online on recognising and combating hate speech, including gender-sensitive reporting. 4.2.2: At least 15-20 journalists have received one-to-one mentorship by subject matter experts/trainers. 4.3.1: 30-40 journalists have been trained online on the production of inclusive media content. 4.3.2:At least 15-20 journalists have received one-to-one mentorship by trainers/experts. 4.4.1: One social media campaign developed (The media development NGO partner gathers IHEC messaging and develops a “Get out and vote” social media campaign promoting active and inclusive participation in the electoral process.) 4.5.1 : 150-200 content pieces consisting of factsheets or fact-checked statements made by power holders in relation to the Iraqi elections published on social media. 4.6.1 :6-10 media monitoring reports produced by CSO’s/Iraqi academics tracking the quality of content produced in relation to the elections, and tracking the IHEC’s performance, with subsequent roundtable evaluation with editors and journalists.

4.1.1: 72 journalists (51 males and 21 females) were trained online and mentored on professional election coverage according to international standards, across Iraq and KRI 4.1.2: 4.2.1: 72 journalists (51 males and 21 females)have been trained online on recognising and combating hate speech, including gender-sensitive reporting. across Iraq and KRI. 4.2.2: 4.3.1:25 are chosen for the second phase , to produce inclusive media content that aims to elevate the voices of women voters and potential candidates, youth, persons with disabilities, and other marginalised groups 4.3.2: 4.4.1: Burj Babel: The six songs were shared on 15 different media and social media outlets, including al-Merbad Radio, Radio Nawa, and UR FM. The songs were aimed at youth were shared on various Facebook pages belonging to media organisations, public intellectual figures etc. Total number of Facebook views: 117,800
Metro Center: Eight videos have been produced out of the twelve scheduled . Of these, six were published during the reporting period on the Metro Center’s social media platforms. Total number of views: +150,000
4.5.1 : Saheeh Iraq launched on 16 August 2021 . Direct outputs by 29 September 2021: Fact checking a total of 98 statements made by government officials, politicians and public figures related to the election.
These statements are further disaggregated: Government Officials: 43 Political Parties and Movements: 36 Human Rights Activists, journalists, intellectuals: 18 Other: 1
Data on Saheeh Iraq’s Reach as of 29 September 2021: • Followers on Facebook: 13,160 • Reach on Facebook: 209,609 • Impressions on Twitter: 14,474
4.6.1 : 3 reports have been produced.
